_description: A tag in the Fasciculus morum, the introductory line to an aphorism

Bod187.Transcription: for he may be þy bote& saue þy synne

Bod410.Transcription: He may be þi bote And bete þi bale

BodLauMis213.Transcription: he may be þi bote & bete þi synne & cetera

BodLauMis568.Transcription: he may be þy betteAnd bote þy synne

BodRawC670.Transcription: He may be þy bote and bote þy synne
BodRawC670.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 203.

CamGon71.Transcription:
he may be þi bote & bete þi synne& sic
                    sauaberis

CamStJohn159.Transcription:
he may be þi bot& bat þi syn & sic
                    saluabis
CamStJohn159.Note: Written as prose; lapses into Latin.

Lincoln44.Transcription: he may be þy bote et bot þy syne & c[etera]

Spalding.Transcription: He may be thy bote & bote þi syn

WorcF19.Transcription: he may be þy bote & bete þy sinne
WorcF19.Note:
Wenzel lists as ‘A’ under ‘Other English
                    Phrases’, Fasc. Morum p. 203; written as prose.
